title: Decoding Market Structure Part 1 Bonus
description: External and internal structure, break of structure, and change of character concepts explained.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• External structure on higher timeframes
• Internal structure on lower timeframes
• How to combine both for better analysis
• Break of Structure (BOS) signals
• Change of Character (CHOCH) definition
• Preventing blind entries with structural analysis

quiz.question: External structure refers to:
quiz.explanation: External structure is the larger timeframe swing that provides context for trading decisions.

quiz.question: Internal structure helps refine:
quiz.explanation: Internal structure provides precise entry timing on lower timeframes within the external structure.

quiz.question: Break of structure (BOS) confirms:
quiz.explanation: BOS confirms a structural shift that typically signals continuation or reversal.

quiz.question: Change of character (CHOCH) signals:
quiz.explanation: CHOCH indicates a possible directional change or shift in market character.

quiz.question: Structural analysis prevents:
quiz.explanation: Proper structural analysis ensures entries have context and reasoning, avoiding blind trades.
